Inofficious.definition: of or relating to a disposition of property that has the effect of depriving descendants of the shares of a succession to which they are entitled by law
Inofficious.origin: [Latin inofficiosus (of a will) ignoring the testator's duty to his relatives, from in- not + officiosus kind, dutiful, from officium service, kindness, duty]

1.1: of or relating to a disposition of property that has the effect of depriving descendants of the shares of a succession to which they are entitled by law
